name: Introductory Biology
description: This course introduces students to the principles of biology, including ecological, organismal, and cellular aspects. Topics include ecology, evolution, genetics, physiology, and biochemistry.

name: General Botany
description: This course introduces the basic principles of plant structure, growth, and reproduction, as well as plant diversity, evolution, ecology, and physiology.

name: Plant Anatomy and Development
description: This course delves deeper into the structure and development of plant tissues and organs, including stems, roots, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

name: Plant Physiology
description: This course covers the physiology of plant growth and development, including photosynthesis, respiration, transpiration, and metabolism.

name: Ecology
description: This course covers the principles of ecology, including population dynamics, community ecology, and ecosystem processes.

name: Mycology
description: This course covers the biology, taxonomy, and diversity of fungi, including their roles in ecosystems and interactions with other organisms.

name: Plant Systematics
description: This course covers the identification, classification, and evolutionary relationships of plants, including the use of taxonomic keys and molecular methods.

name: Plant Ecology
description: This course covers the ecology of plants, including their adaptations to different habitats, interactions with other organisms, and responses to environmental stress.

name: Plant Evolution
description: This course covers the evolutionary history of plants, including the origin and diversification of major plant groups and their relationships to other organisms.

name: Plant Pathology
description: This course covers the biology and ecology of plant diseases, including their causes, transmission, and management.

name: Plant Biotechnology
description: This course covers the principles and applications of plant biotechnology, including genetic engineering, tissue culture, and plant breeding.

name: Plant Molecular Biology
description: This course covers the molecular biology of plants, including the regulation of gene expression, signal transduction, and plant-microbe interactions.
